div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 7px; font-family: "Courier New"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 7px; font-family: "Courier New"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
display: inline-block; font-size: 7px; font-family: "Courier New"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;

td.div: If one child fails only that

tr.td:
If one child fails all child
processes will be restarted

If one child fails all child
processes that started after
that child will be restarted

one_for_one supervisor, where
all child processes are dynamically
added instances of the same process
type (running the same code)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 7px; font-family: "Courier New"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 112px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

div.div: Used to identify the child specification internally by the supervisor. ChildId should be an atom

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 7px; font-family: "Courier New"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;

tr.td:
Child process is never restarted (even when the
supervisor's restart strategy is rest_for_one or
one_for_all and a sibling's death causes the
temporary process to be terminated)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 7px; font-family: "Courier New"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 144px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

tr.td: If more than MaxRestarts occurs within MaxTime seconds the supervisor terminates all child processes and then itself

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 7px; font-family: "Courier New"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;

tr.td:
Terminate child with exit(ChildPid, shutdown)
and then wait infinity time for an exit signal
with reason 'shutdown' back from the child process

Terminate child with exit(ChildPid, shutdown)
and then wait Number ms for an exit signal
with reason 'shutdown' back from the child process.
Terminate child with exit(ChildPid, kill)
if wait more than Number ms

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 7px; font-family: "Courier New"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
display: inline-block; font-size: 7px; font-family: "Courier New"; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;

tr.td:
If the child process is a supervisor,
gen_server or, gen_statem
If the child process is a gen_event
